snippet: With Mr. Trump still at the top of the polls as the calendar moves to October, other candidates feel a growing urgency to stand out.
abstract: Republican presidential hopefuls Jeb Bush, Marco Rubio and John R Kasich trade barbs, signaling beginning of more combative phase as they seek to gain support of party establishment in contest dominated by outlier Donald J Trump.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Greenville, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: With Mr. Trump still at the top of the polls as the calendar moves to October, other candidates feel a growing urgency to stand out.

headline.main: Republican Candidates From Establishment Wing Vie to Take Stage From Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Republican Candidates From Establishment Wing Vie to Take Stage From Trump
